{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2505.00425v1", "title": "A census of face-transitive surfaces", "summary": "A face-transitive surface is a triangulated 2-dimensional manifold whose
automorphism group acts transitively on its set of triangles. In this paper, we
investigate this class of highly symmetric surface triangulations. We identify
seven types of such face-transitive surfaces, splitting up further into a total
of thirteen sub-types, distinguished by how their automorphism groups act on
them. We use these theoretical results to compute a census of face-transitive
surfaces with up to 1280 faces by constructing suitable cycle double covers of
cubic node-transitive graphs.", "main_category": "math.CO", "categories": "math.CO", "published": "2025-05-01T09:52:10Z"}
